meanings.definition: To disturb the composure of; to make uneasy or anxious.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected news about the test results was very unsetting for the students.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site unsetting the peaceful atmosphere of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act was so unsetting that the audience couldn't stop talking about it.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead were unsetting, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house was truly unsetting, sending shivers down everyone's spines.

meanings.sent1: The scratchy fabric of the old couch was quite unsetting to sit on.
meanings.sent2: The unsettling feeling in the room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The unsetting sound of nails on a chalkboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The unsetting shadows in the dimly lit alley gave off a creepy vibe.
meanings.sent5: The unsetting dream left her feeling anxious and restless all day.
